newsitem.title: AUSTRALIA: RTRS-Australia dlr slides, under pressure at $0.77.
newsitem.headline: RTRS-Australia dlr slides, under pressure at $0.77.

text.p: The Australian dollar slid almost 1/2 cent Thursday to touch fresh 5-1/5 month lows and pressure important support in the US$0.7700/10 area.

Traders said heavy offshore selling from a range of sources including local, European and Asian names, swamped exporter and U.S. investment bank bids at US$0.7720 and triggered stop loss offers down to a US$0.7701/06 low.

This area provided sterling support when the currency was last down here in August last year and was holding for the moment. But dealers said downtrend momentum was building and a test of US$0.7680 looked close at hand.
The latter level was the trough reached last August when the dollar was suffering the fallout from a surprise rate cut from the Reserve Bank on July 31.
If the bulwark cracked this time, analysts reckoned it would be very bearish for the currency and could well result in a downtrend to 75 or even 74 cents in the medium term.
By 2.00 pm (0300 GMT) the local dollar was looking sick at US$0.7700/05 having crumpled from an early US$0.7758/63 and US$0.7768/73 late here Wednesday.
